title: G7七大成員國外相發表香港問題聯合聲明

replies.msg:
Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab said:

Today’s statement shows the strength of international concern over China’s proposed new national security law for Hong Kong. As the G7, we are calling on China to adhere to its legally binding international commitments and respect the autonomy and the freedom of the people of Hong Kong.

The statement issued today by the Foreign Ministers of the United States, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the High Representative of the European Union, says that the proposed national security law would risk seriously undermining the “One Country, Two Systems” principle and the territory’s high degree of autonomy. It would also jeopardise the system which has allowed Hong Kong to become one of the world’s most prosperous regions.

外交大臣藍韜文說：

今天的聲明顯示，國際社會對中國擬議的香港國安法的關注日益增強。作為七國集團，我們呼籲中國遵守其具有法律約束力的國際承諾，並尊重香港人民的自治和自由。

美國，加拿大，法國，德國，意大利，日本，英國和歐洲聯盟高級代表的外交部長今天發表的聲明說，擬議中的國安法將有可能嚴重損害一國兩制的原則與香港的高度自治。這也將危及使香港成為世界上最繁榮地區之一的體制。

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/g7-urges-china-to-reconsider-national-security-law

出聲明個timing 真係擺到明撚狗

Stuart Lau
@stuartlauscmp
The G7 statement is well-timed to be released just hours before China's top legislative body – the National People's Congress Standing Committee – is due to convene a meeting Thursday Beijing time. Unclear if national security law is on the agenda or not.

G7 also released the statement while Mike Pompeo – one of the co-signing parties – is in Hawaii to meet China's top diplomat, Yang Jiechi.

https://twitter.com/stuartlauscmp/status/1273337114957172736
